t: Ezekiel 27
Lament over Tyre
Moreover,*p the word of the Lord*s came to me saying,
“And you, son of man, take up a lamentation over Tyre;
and say to Tyre, who dwells at the entrance to the sea, merchant of the peoples to many coastlands, ‘Thus says the Lord God,*s “O*pn Tyre, you have said, ‘I am perfect in beauty.’
Your*ln borders are in the heart of the seas; Your*ln builders have perfected your beauty.
They*ln have made all your*i planks of fir trees from Senir; They*ln have taken a cedar from Lebanon to make a mast for you.
Of*ln oaks from Bashan they have made your oars; With*ln ivory they have inlaid your deck of boxwood from the coastlands of Cyprus.
Your*ln sail was of fine embroidered linen from Egypt So*ln that it became your distinguishing mark; Your*ln awning was blue and purple from the coastlands of Elishah.
The*ln inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad were your rowers; Your*ln wise men, O Tyre, were aboard; they were your pilots.
The*ln elders of Gebal and her wise men were with you repairing your seams; All*ln the ships of the sea and their sailors were with you in order to deal in your merchandise.
“Persia*p and Lud and Put were in your army, your men of war. They hung shield and helmet in you; they set forth your splendor.
The sons of Arvad and your army were on your walls, all*i around, and the Gammadim were in your towers. They hung their shields on your walls all*i around; they perfected your beauty.
“Tarshish*p was your customer because of the abundance of all kinds*i of wealth; with silver, iron, tin and lead they paid for your wares.
Javan, Tubal and Meshech, they were your traders; with the lives of men and vessels of bronze they paid for your merchandise.
Those from Beth-togarmah gave horses and war horses and mules for your wares.
The sons of Dedan were your traders. Many coastlands were your market; ivory tusks and ebony they brought as your payment.
Aram was your customer because of the abundance of your goods; they paid for your wares with emeralds, purple, embroidered work, fine linen, coral and rubies.
Judah and the land of Israel, they were your traders; with the wheat of Minnith, cakes, honey, oil and balm they paid for your merchandise.
Damascus was your customer because of the abundance of your goods, because of the abundance of all kinds*i of wealth, because of the wine of Helbon and white wool.
Vedan and Javan paid for your wares from Uzal; wrought iron, cassia and sweet cane were among your merchandise.
Dedan traded with you in saddlecloths for riding.
Arabia and all the princes of Kedar, they were your customers for lambs, rams and goats; for these they were your customers.
The traders of Sheba and Raamah, they traded with you; they paid for your wares with the best of all kinds*i of spices, and with all kinds*i of precious stones and gold.
Haran, Canneh, Eden, the traders of Sheba, Asshur and*i Chilmad traded with you.
They traded with you in choice garments, in clothes of blue and embroidered work, and in carpets of many colors and*i tightly wound cords, which*i were*i among your merchandise.
The ships of Tarshish were the carriers for your merchandise. And*pn you were filled and were very glorious In*ln the heart of the seas.
“Your*ln rowers have brought you Into*ln great waters; The*ln east wind has broken you In*ln the heart of the seas.

Your*ln wealth, your wares, your merchandise, Your*ln sailors and your pilots, Your*ln repairers of seams, your dealers in merchandise And*ln all your men of war who are in you, With*ln all your company that is in your midst, Will*ln fall into the heart of the seas On*ln the day of your overthrow.
At*ln the sound of the cry of your pilots The*ln pasture lands will shake.
All*ln who handle the oar, The*ln sailors and*i all the pilots of the sea Will*ln come down from their ships; They*ln will stand on the land,
And*ln they will make their voice heard over you And*ln will cry bitterly. They*ln will cast dust on their heads, They*ln will wallow in ashes.
Also*ln they will make themselves bald for you And*ln gird themselves with sackcloth; And*ln they will weep for you in bitterness of soul With*ln bitter mourning.
Moreover,*ln in their wailing they will take up a lamentation for you And*ln lament over you: ‘Who*ln is like Tyre, Like*ln her who is silent in the midst of the sea?
When*ln your wares went out from the seas, You*ln satisfied many peoples; With*ln the abundance of your wealth and your merchandise You*ln enriched the kings of earth.
Now*ln that you are broken by the seas In*ln the depths of the waters, Your*ln merchandise and all your company Have*ln fallen in the midst of you.
All*ln the inhabitants of the coastlands Are*ln appalled at you, And*ln their kings are horribly afraid; They*ln are troubled in countenance.
The*ln merchants among the peoples hiss at you; You*ln have become terrified And*ln you will cease to be forever.’ ” ’ ”
